meanings.definition: A persistent feeling of ill will or resentment resulting from a past insult or injury.
meanings.sent1: She held a grudge against her friend for not inviting her to the party.
meanings.sent2: His grudge towards his brother started when he broke his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The grudge between the two siblings made family gatherings awkward.
meanings.sent4: The grudge in her heart grew like a dark cloud, overshadowing her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The grudge she carried was like a heavy burden, weighing her down every day.

meanings.definition: To be resentful or envious of (someone) for (a possession or attribute).
meanings.sent1: She would often grudge her sister's success in school.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to grudge his friend's new car, but he couldn't help feeling envious.
meanings.sent3: It was hard for him not to grudge his colleague's promotion, even though he tried to be happy for them.
meanings.sent4: She grudged her neighbor's beautiful garden, wishing hers could look the same.
meanings.sent5: The way he grudged his classmate's talent was evident in his jealous glances.

meanings.definition: To give or allow reluctantly or resentfully.
meanings.sent1: She would grudge him access to the secret room in the house.
meanings.sent2: He grudged her the last piece of cake, but eventually gave it to her.
meanings.sent3: He grudged sharing his toys with his little brother, but did so begrudgingly.
meanings.sent4: She grudged him the opportunity to prove himself, doubting his abilities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher grudged the students extra time on the test, feeling it was unfair to others.
